io.github.teamfractal.entity

Class PlayerTest.PlayerSingleTests

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.teamfractal.entity.PlayerTest.PlayerSingleTests
  • Enclosing class:
    PlayerTest

    public static class PlayerTest.PlayerSingleTests
extends java.lang.Object
    Josh Neil moved any tests that are non-parametrised and should only be ran once into this class

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      org.junit.rules.ExpectedException exception 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PlayerSingleTests() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void setUp()
      Runs before every test and creates the Player object that is udner test as well as the RoboticonQuest object that is requried by some tests
      void testPlayerAddLandPlot()
      Tests Player.addLandPlot(LandPlot) ensures that the LandPlot is added to the player's land list when the given plot is owned by the player and not already in their land list
      void testPlayerAddLandPlotAlreadyInLandList()
      Tests Player.addLandPlot(LandPlot) ensures that the LandPlot is not added to the player's land list when the given plot is owned by the player and already in their land list
      void testPlayerAddLandPlotOwnedBySomeoneElse()
      Tests Player.addLandPlot(LandPlot) ensures that the LandPlot is not added to the player's land list when the given plot is owned by another player
      void testPlayerAddLandPlotUnowned()
      Tests Player.addLandPlot(LandPlot) ensures that the LandPlot is not added to the player's land list when the given plot is not owned by any player
      void testPlayerBuyResource()
      Tests Player.purchaseResourceFromMarket(int, Market, ResourceType) and ensures that the correct amount of money is removed from the players inventory, the correct amount of resources are added to the player's inventory and the correct amount of resources are removed from the market's inventory
      void testPlayerCanCustomiseOwnedRoboticons()
      Tests Player.customiseRoboticon(Roboticon, ResourceType) and ensures that players can customise roboticons that they own
      void testPlayerCanCustomiseRoboticon()
      Tests Player.customiseRoboticon(Roboticon, ResourceType) and ensures that players can customise roboticons
      void testPlayerCannotBuyMoreThanAllowed()
      Tests Player.purchaseResourceFromMarket(int, Market, ResourceType) ensures that players cannot buy more of a given resource than the market possesses
      void testPlayerCannotSellMoreEnergyThanAllowed()
      Tests Player.sellResourceToMarket(int, Market, ResourceType) ensures that the player cannot sell more energy than they have in their possession
      void testPlayerCannotSellMoreFoodThanAllowed()
      Tests Player.sellResourceToMarket(int, Market, ResourceType) ensures that the player cannot sell more food than they have in their possession
      void testPlayerCannotSellMoreOreThanAllowed()
      Tests Player.sellResourceToMarket(int, Market, ResourceType) ensures that the player cannot sell more ore than they have in their possession
      void testPlayerInitialMoney()
      Ensures that the quantity of money initially in the player's inventory is correct
      void testPlayerRemoveLandPlot()
      Tests Player.removeLandPlot(LandPlot) ensures that when the given plot is removed when it is owned by the player and in their land list
      void testPlayerRemoveLandPlotNotOwned()
      Tests Player.removeLandPlot(LandPlot) ensures that when the no plots are removed when the given LandPlot is not owned by anyone
      void testPlayerRemoveLandPlotOwnedbyAnotherPlayer()
      Tests Player.removeLandPlot(LandPlot) ensures that when the no plots are removed when the given LandPlot is owned by another player
      void testPlayerSellResource()
      Tests Player.sellResourceToMarket(int, Market, ResourceType) and ensures that the correct amount of money is added to the players inventory, the correct amount of resources are removed from the player's inventory and the correct amount of resources are added to the market's inventory

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • testPlayerSellResource

        public void testPlayerSellResource()
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Tests Player.sellResourceToMarket(int, Market, ResourceType) and ensures that the correct amount of money is added to the players inventory, the correct amount of resources are removed from the player's inventory and the correct amount of resources are added to the market's inventory
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • testPlayerCannotBuyMoreThanAllowed

        public void testPlayerCannotBuyMoreThanAllowed()
                                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Tests Player.purchaseResourceFromMarket(int, Market, ResourceType) ensures that players cannot buy more of a given resource than the market possesses

        Also ensures that the players inventory does not change when they try to do this

        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An exception should be thrown when the player tries to buy more of a given resource than is allowed

      • testPlayerCannotSellMoreEnergyThanAllowed

        public void testPlayerCannotSellMoreEnergyThanAllowed()
                                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Tests Player.sellResourceToMarket(int, Market, ResourceType) ensures that the player cannot sell more energy than they have in their possession
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An exception should be thrown when the player tries to do this
